text:
Hello:

We have Redhat linux ES 3.0 with Apache 2.0.49 custom build. we have
tomcat-4.1.30 as Application server , mysql-4.0.18  as Database server.

Apache is enabled with SSL . openssl version - openssl-0.9.7a

The httpd server hangs frequently, we get the following error message in the
error log file.

################################

httpd: md_rand.c:312: ssleay_rand_add: Assertion `md_c[1] == md_count[1]' failed.
[Mon Jun 14 13:13:53 2004] [notice] child pid 21131 exit signal Aborted (6)

[Mon Jun 14 15:26:34 2004] [warn] child process 21130 still did not exit,
sending a SIGTERM

httpd: md_rand.c:312: ssleay_rand_add: Assertion `md_c[1] == md_count[1]' failed.
[Mon Jun 14 17:03:16 2004] [notice] child pid 29016 exit signal Aborted (6)

[Mon Jun 14 17:27:22 2004] [warn] child process 29017 still did not exit,
sending a SIGTERM

Regards.,
Raja
creator: ralagar_raja@email.com

text:
regarding the hang...

Apache on RHES 3.0 will (I think) use cross-process pthread mutexes for the
accept mutex.  This can cause hangs after child process crashes.  To verify that
your build is using cross-process pthread mutexes, see if "apachectl -V" displays

  -D APR_USE_PROC_PTHREAD_SERIALIZE

as part of the output.

Add "AcceptMutex sysvsem" to httpd.conf to work around this issue.

The original crash seems to be some openssl issue.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
httpd: md_rand.c:312: ssleay_rand_add: Assertion `md_c[1] == md_count[1]' failed.
[Mon Jun 14 17:03:16 2004] [notice] child pid 29016 exit signal Aborted (6)

OpenSSL assertions like this are typically due to a mismatch between OpenSSL
headers used at build time and libraries chosen at run time, unlikely that there
is an httpd bug here.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
